diagnoses: Suspect systemic disease - need thorough workup

Vitamin Deficiencies (e.g., Vitamin D, Vitamin B12)
Hashimotos thyroiditis (can sometimes present with temporary hyperthyroidism)
Drug-induced (e.g., certain medications can cause these symptoms)
Chronic illnesses (e.g., celiac disease, kidney disease)
Genetic syndromes (other than those listed above)

Meningitis (consider if symptoms are severe and accompanied by fever, stiff neck)
Brain tumor (consider if headaches are persistent, worsen over time, or accompanied by neurological symptoms)
Stroke (consider if symptoms are sudden and severe)
Aneurysm (consider if headaches are sudden, severe, and described as \the worst headache of my life\)
Carbon monoxide poisoning (consider if other household members have similar symptoms)
Glaucoma (consider if eye pain and vision changes are also present)
Inner ear problems (e.g., labyrinthitis, vestibular neuritis)
